definition: ancient office title/rich and important person
to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: Later Jin Dynasty was also once abolished Hanlin degree, their functions and to go in the book rounding.
sentences.chinese: 后晋还一度废除翰林学士，其职并归中书舍人。

sentences.english: A spokesman for OMA confirmed Mr. Scheeren's remarks.
sentences.chinese: 大都会建筑事务所的发言人证实了舍人的话。

definition: official registrar (of a county etc) in imperial China
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
Grand Servant in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
member of a monarch's inner ministerial circle (old)
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
same as 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] Book of History
Commandant of Guards (in imperial China), one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
